Cardiovascular System

Heart and circulation terminology

📚 5 Terms 🎯 2 Basic ⚡ 2 Intermediate 🔥 1 Advanced
❤️

Study Cardiovascular System

Master 5 essential medical terms

Intermediate

Myocardial Infarction

Click to see definition

Intermediate

Myocardial Infarction

Definition:

Death of heart muscle tissue due to lack of blood supply, commonly known as a heart attack

Clinical Example:

The patient presented with chest pain and was diagnosed with an acute myocardial infarction

Basic

Hypertension

Click to see definition

Basic

Hypertension

Definition:

High blood pressure, defined as systolic pressure ≥140 mmHg or diastolic pressure ≥90 mmHg

Clinical Example:

Chronic hypertension increases the risk of stroke and kidney disease

Basic

Arrhythmia

Click to see definition

Basic

Arrhythmia

Definition:

Irregular heartbeat or abnormal heart rhythm

Clinical Example:

The ECG showed atrial fibrillation, a common type of arrhythmia

Intermediate

Atherosclerosis

Click to see definition

Intermediate

Atherosclerosis

Definition:

Hardening and narrowing of arteries due to plaque buildup

Clinical Example:

Atherosclerosis in the coronary arteries can lead to angina and heart attacks

Advanced

Cardiomyopathy

Click to see definition

Advanced

Cardiomyopathy

Definition:

Disease of the heart muscle that affects its ability to pump blood effectively

Clinical Example:

Dilated cardiomyopathy resulted in the patient's heart failure symptoms
